text:
Immediately into your personal topic: Al Dente Pasteuria in Green City

01 Nov 2019, 05:30



Telegram channel "Minsk and Minsk". Unexpected alleys of Minsk, strange finds, funny details. Content is not duplicated anywhere!


I thought this was the beginning of some new network history, but then I read the press and it turned out that I hadn‚Äôt yet - Al Dente pasteurization was launched at least so far in a single copy in Green City on the second floor above Sadovoy‚Äôs Khinkalnya. The signboard was familiar to me for a long time, and the reason to take dinner arose only last Sunday, when we went to the mall to entertain the younger child. Al Dente left the most pleasant experience, it‚Äôs not a sin to come back here again, or even call specially.
On the way home in a taxi, I leafed through the reviews at the cafe and mentally sent rays of sympathy to the owners. God, what nonsense some people write - either on purpose, or out of ignorance. How sharp are the assessments where, if there is room for criticism, then criticism is fair and to the point.
For example, Al Dente created a progressive "collective" hall - in the middle of the hall there are several common tables for many seats, which should create some kind of democratic fast casual atmosphere. In fact, people sit around the perimeter, where there are separate sofas and seats for 2-4 people. For 20 years, the Mac did not teach us to sit at a table with strangers without internal resistance, even if it is not a table, but only a desk, and here - Al Dente with waiters and without much democracy in prices.






But I have nothing more to say in the negative part of the review. More precisely, this is not even a criticism of the design of the premises as such, but a criticism of the managerial decision ... although, suddenly, I'm wrong?
In short, in fact, the appearance of Al Dente is beautiful in its simplicity. The buzz of colors and all this IKEA philosophy, when a table is just a table - they sit and eat at it. What else is needed from the table, except for a flat surface and accuracy of execution?
On the sides of the hall there is an open kitchen and a bar. It is not difficult to guess that the central place in the kitchen is torsion of pasta. They are made here manually, everything can be seen.






The menu includes all the main Italian dishes: macaroni, pizza, ravioli, wine. There are a couple of soups and salads. There are not many positions, which I welcome with both hands.



I think Al Dente was fully launched as a partial self-service cafe (fast casual most often involves ordering at the bar, and delivery of ready meals by the waiter), but I just checked with the administrator just in case, and she said that the waiter accepts the order and brings it.



I took nisoise and carbonara, so as not to make complicated stories. The youngest dined with soup with pasta and meat, but I can only give a photo because I have not tried it.



Of course, the last clochard from Provence would have fought hysterically from such a nisoise, but I believe that there are no strict standards in cooking, even if we are talking about a sign dish. Well, nicoise with slices of cold potatoes and tuna and no anchovies, so what? For example, I have never eaten anything else in my life, and even in Nice, Nicoise was served with tuna fillet.
The main thing is that in Al Dente it is not canned. This is victory!






And everything was tasty, fresh, with a slight sourness, as it should be in decent houses.
Lord, what a carbonara it was! She was incredible, that's what!



Drooling even now when I write the text üòÇ Bombic carbonara with a delicate creamy taste and firm pasta, with a beautiful brackish brisket. I would easily put a whole pot of such wonderful food, I swear.
Nothing more, just the top.
Score:



I‚Äôll go again.
